text:
Printable_docs target in the build.xml file seems to use the wrong 
destination - it should be printable_docs.src, not docs.src, surely?
creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk

text:
Sorry, that should be .dest, not .src - the rule should surely read: 
destdir="${printable_docs.dest}/" 
not 
destdir="${docs.dest}/"

[Otherwise the printable HTML overwrites the ordinary HTML ...]
creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk

text:
Just found a problem with the suggested change - the resulting html pages try 
to link to the images in the docs/images directory, and demos in docs/demos.

The "docs" target gets round this by copying in these files from xdocs, so this 
should also be done to the printable-docs target.

If the printable-docs destination directory is left as "docs" then there are 
still some problems with the build file:
- the printable-docs target does not copy in the images and demos
- if the docs target is run first, this creates images and demos OK, but then 
printable-docs does nothing, as all the html pages are considered up-to-date...
creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
